intro: Tragacantha microcystis, commonly known as the small-celled tragacanth, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of the Middle East and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and distinctive, hairy leaves. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural thickening agent. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and compound leaves. Tragacantha microcystis thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important plant in ecological and medicinal contexts.
